SOURCE ID: Author/Org, Date, Info: Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change. (2015). Climate change 2014: mitigation of climate change (Vol. 3). Cambridge University Press. Fig TS.27
Original Units: US$2014 levelized cost per t CO2
Assumptions: The IPCC WGIII AR5 (2014) estimate the cost of CO2 emission intensity reductions for cement with an indicative levelized cost of <$0-$50 per tonne of CO2 conserved for the 450ppm CO2-eq scenario (i.e. for  "best practice clinker substitution"). We assume that each tonne of FA conserves 0.79 t CO2, so the cost of FA is about (price)*0.79.

SOURCE ID: Author/Org, Date, Info: Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change. (2015). Climate change 2014: mitigation of climate change (Vol. 3). Cambridge University Press. Fig TS.27

Assumptions: The IPCC WGIII AR5 (2014) estimate the cost of CO2 emission intensity reductions for cement with an indicative levelized cost of <$0-$50 per tonne of CO2 conserved for the 450ppm CO2-eq scenario (i.e. for  "best practice clinker substitution").
